titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Robert Alfred Theobald papers, 1908-1959
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Paul Karpuk

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-04T14:49-0800

change.item: Declassified materials returned to collection by Sarah Patton.
Declassified records series added by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden.
Container list updated after rehousing by Elizabeth Phillips.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Robert Alfred Theobald Papers)//EN" "theobara.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, war diaries, dispatches, operations plans and orders, manuals, service lists, memoranda, reports, and war estimates relating to naval operations in Alaska from May 1942 to January 1943, including the Japanese invasion of the Aleutians, June 1942, and the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert Alfred Theobald papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1960.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Gunnery Officer, U.S.S. New York, Flagship of U.S. Squadron with British Grand Fleet
Executive Officer, Naval Post Graduate School
Commanding Officer, Naval Post Graduate School
Secretary of War Plans, Navy Department and Member of Joint Army - Navy Planning Committee
Chief of Staff, Destroyers, Pacific Fleet
Member of Advanced Class, Naval War College, engaged in seminar study of Japan and Pacific War
Commander, Flotilla One, Destroyers, Pacific Fleet
Commander, Northern Pacific Force, in Alaska Operations
Commandant, First Naval District and Navy Yard, Boston
Author, The Final Secret of Pearl Harbor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches and writings, war diaries, dispatches, operations plans and orders, manuals, service lists, memoranda, reports, and war estimates relating to naval operations in Alaska from May 1942 to January 1943, including the Japanese invasion of the Aleutians, June 1942, and the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Kalbfus, Admiral E. C. (Commander Destroyers, Battle Force),
Simon, Frank J. (Secretary-Treasurer, Master Mechanics Association, Naval Ship Yard, Boston, MA),
Smith, Commander and Mrs. Steele B.,
Wang, K. S. (Consulate of the Republic of China),
Who's Who in the Western Hemisphere,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, books, and speeches, arranged as listed, then chronologically thereunder. Includes correspondence and book reviews related to these works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings of articles written by Robert A. Theobald for a biweekly column in the Beverly Evening Times, "Horizons in World and National Affairs."

did.unittitle: Death of a Navy, by Andrieu d'Albas (1957),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Translated from the French and with an introduction, maps, and notes by Robert A. Theobald.

Supplementary materials to text: maps, notes, charts, etc.
The Final Secret of Pearl Harbor (1954),

did.physdesc: Typewritten carbon copy of an unpublished manuscript.
Typewritten draft and typewritten carbon copy.

did.unittitle: Address to workers of the Boston Navy Yard and South Boston Naval Drydock,
Address to Naval Graduating Units, Harvard University,
Response to the toast The United States Navy at the Annual Dinner of the Ancient and Honorable Artillery Company of Massachusetts,
Address to workers of the Boston Navy Yard and South Boston Naval Drydock,
Address at Presentation of Army and Navy "E" Award to Boston Navy Yard at Boston Garden,
Address at Commissioning of U.S.S. Wasp,
Interview with Admiral Theobald on radio program Life to the Front, station WEEI,
Radio talk by Rear Admiral Theobald over station WHDH,
Address before the Men's Corporate Communion Grace Church in Salem, Massachusetts,
War Diaries, Commander North Pacific Force, Task Force Eight, U.S. Pacific Fleet,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ships' logs and transcripts of radio dispatches, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dispatches, inventory reports, manuals, memoranda and reports, Navy Department correspondence and orders, operations plans and orders, service lists, and war estimates, arranged as listed, then chronologically thereunder. See also: Declassified U.S. Government Records.

did.unittitle: Assistance Information and Data Acquisition Center (AIDAC) dispatches,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: These consist of decoded messages between Commander-in-Chief Pacific Fleet (CINCPAC) and Commander Northwestern Sea Front (COMNOWESTSEAFRON), concerning Japanese operations against Midway and the Aleutians.

did.unittitle: Dispatches from the Commander of Task Force 8 to the Commander of Task Group 8.1 and the Commanding General of Eleventh Air Force, Fort Greely, Alaska,
Inventory reports, Inventory Reports of Registered Secret and Confidential Publications Distributed by the Chief of Naval Operations,

unittitle.emph: Staff Manual, Cruiser Division Three, Battle Force, United States Fleet,
Staff Instructions, Destroyer Flotilla One, United States Pacific Fleet,
Staff Instructions, Destroyers, Battle Force, United States Pacific Fleet,

did.unittitle: Sound Military Decision, U.S. Naval War College, Newport, RI,
Report from Headquarters of 11th Air Force Air Striking Group (Task Group 8.3), Kodiak, Alaska to Commanding General, Alaska Defense Command, Fort Richardson, Alaska

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Summary of operations to June 10th, 1942 (tactical employment of 11th Air Force in first phase of Japanese invasion of Aleutians), with relevant dispatches and notes.

did.unittitle: Memorandum on the situation in Alaska,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written by Admiral Theobald for the Commandant of the Thirteenth Naval District at the latter's request for information on the Alaska situation.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of Comtaskforce 8 concerning the proposed relocation of Headquarters of Fleet Air Wing Four to Adak,
"Analysis of Command Relationship Between Commander Task Force Eight and Commanding General Eleventh Air Force,"
Memoranda on the grounding of the U.S.S. Alexander J. Luke,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written by the Commander-in-Chief of the United States Fleet and Chief of Naval Operations, Fleet Admiral Ernest J. King, for the Commandant of the First Naval District, Rear Admiral Robert A. Theobald.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes orders from, and correspondence with, Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz (CINCPAC), Fleet Admiral Ernest J. King (COMINCH), Frank Knox (Secretary of the Navy), Franklin D. Roosevelt (as acting Secretary of the Navy and as President), Major-General Simon Bolivar Buckner, Rear Admiral Randall Jacobs (Chief of the Bureau of Navigation), and others.

did.unittitle: Comtaskunit 8.1.1 (Air Striking Unit, Eleventh Air Force)
Comtaskunit 8.1.2 (Air Search Unit, Eleventh Air Force), No. 3-42,
Comtaskgroup 8.3 (Air Striking Group, Eleventh Air Force)
U.S.S. Nashville (flagship of Task Force 8), Outline of Plan for Handling Flare Attack,
Directive for Provision of Aircraft Support to Ships at Sea

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles and letters, arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Tragedy of George Marshall by Walter Trohan, The American Mercury.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters of condolence on the occasion of Admiral Theobald's death and memorial service program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Foreword to The Soviet Impact on Society by Dr. Dagobert D. Runes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Operations plans, war diaries, orders, correspondence, and dispatches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appendices to Operation Plans and Communication Plans. See also: Naval Career Office File.
